frontmatter.title: God does the impossible!
frontmatter.description: God can do the impossible in your life!

frontmatter.title: Introducing the Sword of the Spirit
frontmatter.description: What is the the Sword of the Spirit. It's the Word of God. It's your weapon against the enemy. It's sharper than any double-edged sword!

frontmatter.title: True meaning of Christmas
frontmatter.description: What is Christmas about? Why do we celebrate it? These are all some great questions. Let's take a look at the true meaning of Christmas

frontmatter.title: Latest Updates!
frontmatter.description: It's been awhile since you guys have heard from me. Some of you may be wondering what happened to me?

frontmatter.title: Happy Thanksgiving
frontmatter.description: We can give thanks to God in all times in life. God deserves all our praise

verses.overrideVerse: [16] “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life. (ESV)
[11] For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope. (ESV)
[13] I can do all things through him who strengthens me. (ESV)
[22] But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, (ESV)

[3] Commit your work to the LORD,
        and your plans will be established. (ESV)
[12] Again Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.” (ESV)
[8] For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, (ESV)
[6] do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. (ESV)

[38] For I am sure that neither death nor life, nor angels nor rulers, nor things present nor things to come, nor powers, [39] nor height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord. (ESV)
[33] But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you. (ESV)
[28] And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose. (ESV)
